docs.snippet: The campaign official, Rick Gates, has pleaded guilty in the investigation by the special counsel into Russian election interference.

docs.snippet: While President Trump had largely sought to avoid alienating the special counsel in recent months, he has shifted his tone in the past two days.

docs.snippet: The lawyer, John Dowd, said he was speaking on behalf of President Trump, only to backtrack shortly afterward and say he was speaking only for himself.

docs.snippet: Cambridge Analytica, a company that developed technology to target voters, has denied having connections to Russia. But evidence suggests otherwise.

docs.snippet: What is at stake in this dispute is nothing less than American rule of law.

docs.snippet: Recent steps on a Russia inquiry, gun control measures and more illustrate a close alignment between congressional Republicans and President Trump.

docs.snippet: Far from learning on the job or modifying his views, Mr. Trump is falling back on the familiar mix of belligerence and isolationism that fueled his campaign.

docs.snippet: Readers say “give the president a chance to experiment,” cite Alexander Hamilton’s beliefs about tariffs and suggest a form of sanctions.
